A classical MD simulation was performed by using the Large-scale Atomic
] program to produce the internal energy of the system with the same
] as those for calculations of the PF. Speciï¬cally, the time step as set as 0.1 fs,
and the velocities of the silicon atoms were assigned according to a time integration on NoseâHoover
equations of motion to keep the systemat a given temperature. Then, the internal energies (
the temperature were recorded every 30 fs to performthe average over 100 records.
) obtained by the MD simulations with a relative standard deviation of 0.008%, which is too

. For temperatures lower than 500 K, the relative error (
was only 0.001%and gradually increased up to 0.021%for 1300 K. It may be expected that the relative

of the edge atoms was calculated, instead of replacing
